clinical_study.brief_title: Vasomotor Reactivity In Cerebral Small Vessel Disease And New Approach To Treat Lacunar Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Lacunar-Brain Infarction Cerebral Hyperactivity And Atorvastatin Trial. A Placebo-Controlled Trial Of High-Dose Atorvastatin In Patients With Cerebral Small Vessel Disease.

lead_sponsor.agency: Pfizer's Upjohn has merged with Mylan to form Viatris Inc.

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of atorvastatin treatment during 3 months (80mg/day) on cerebral vasoreactivity (CVR) in lacunar patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the efficacy of atorvastatin treatment during 3 months (80mg/day) on cerebral vasoreactivity (CVR) in lacunar patients. CVR, humeral and carotid vasoreactivity will be measured in all patients at M0 and M3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the efficacy of atorvastatin treatment during 3 months (80mg/day) on endothelium dependant and independent vasomotoricity of humeral and / or common carotid artery (according to validation study) in lacunar patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- clinically defined lacunar syndrome 3 months before inclusion
- small deep infarct on diffusion MRI (Diffusion Weighted Imaging)
- no atherothrombotic, cardio-embolic, or other rarer cause.
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with past coronary event
- contra-indication for assessment of vasomotor reactivity
- patients being on statin therapy at the time of brain infarction
- contra-indication for statin therapy
- patient still under statin therapy
